messages.content:
I checked your inbox and found John’s message asking me to upload the attached images to the emmajohnson/image_transformation repository under images/. I was able to download one attachment so far:

- Downloaded: attachment id "6" → cat.jpg (saved to /downloads)

I could not download the other two attachment ids ("7" and "8") — the downloader only returned id "6".

Before I proceed, a few confirmations so I do exactly what you want (I won’t run any Git/GitHub commands until you confirm):

1. Do you want me to upload the single file I already downloaded (cat.jpg) now, or wait until you resend/provide the other attachments (7 and 8)?
2. If you want me to upload now:
   - Commit message to use? (suggestion: "Add images from John")
   - Branch to push to? (suggestion: main)
   - Create images/ directory if it doesn’t exist? (suggestion: yes)
3. If you want me to upload later when you resend the missing files, you can either:
   - Ask John to re-send the attachments, or
   - Forward me direct download links or the file IDs that work.
4. Confirm I should clone emmajohnson/image_transformation and push the files to that repo (I’ll use the repo name exactly as John specified).

Tell me which option and the commit/branch preferences and I’ll proceed (clone → add images/ → commit → push). If you want, I can also draft a short commit message for you to approve.
